revised_title: Circumpolar Expedition to Fort Rae: Magnetic and Meteorological Observations
tldr: The author describes their journey and observations during the Circumpolar Expedition to Fort Rae. They discuss the magnetic instruments used, the challenges faced, and the relationship between magnetic disturbances and auroras. The author also shares meteorological observations, including wind patterns and temperature readings.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Geomagnetism and Atmospheric Science
